title: Minneapolis Police Release Footage They Say Shows Suspect Fired First
sub_head: The Wednesday night incident is the first time the city’s police have killed someone since George Floyd in May
body:
Minneapolis police on Thursday released body camera footage of a fatal police shooting that they said showed the man firing first on police.
The incident, which took place Wednesday night, is the first time the city’s police have killed someone since the Memorial Day death of George Floyd.
Body camera footage shows multiple police vehicles blocking a white sedan, the driver of which appears to attempt to drive through the line of vehicles. Shouts of “Hands up, hands up…police!” can be heard. The man appears to shoot first, breaking the driver-side window. Police then fire at the car.
“A tragic and difficult day is capping what’s been a tragic and difficult year,” said Mayor Jacob Frey. “Our city is experiencing a lot of raw emotion right now.”
Chief Medaria Arradondo said in a Thursday press conference that he had met with family members of the man who was killed by police and watched the body camera footage with them before releasing it to the public.
